title: Global Climate Coalition Reaches Emissions Pact
excerpt: Leaders from 70 nations agreed on binding methane cuts and fresh climate finance benchmarks after marathon talks in Nairobi. Observers say the pact revives trust ahead of next years compliance window.
author: Anika Bose

image.alt: Delegates signing a climate agreement

title: Digital ID Fast-Track Links Emerging Markets
excerpt: Finance ministers endorsed an interoperable ID rail to unlock cheaper remittances and portable health records. Pilot corridors covering 1.2 billion people will go live within six months.
author: Mateo Alvarez

image.alt: Screens showing secure digital identity tokens

title: Northern Corridor Summit Unlocks Infrastructure Funds
excerpt: East African states secured $18B for rail modernization and hybrid ports to ease commodity bottlenecks. The package ties disbursements to transparent procurement dashboards overseen by regional auditors.
author: Nadia Kamau

image.alt: Freight corridor investment map

title: Asia-Pacific Ports Resume Ops After Typhoon Repairs
excerpt: Logistics groups restored 80% capacity by deploying modular power barges and flexible berths across Manila, Kaohsiung, and Osaka. Relief lanes now prioritize medical cargo and cold-chain food staples.
author: Kenji Morita

image.alt: Container cranes above teal waves

title: Global Food Security Fund Expands Emergency Stockpiles
excerpt: Donor blocs doubled rapid-response grain reserves and linked payouts to satellite drought triggers. Agencies expect the move to cut delivery times to high-risk regions by half.
author: Leila Moreau

image.alt: Stylized grain reserves illustration
